alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 01 at 4:44PM CST until January 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...In Kansas, Phillips and Smith Counties. In Nebraska, Fillmore, Webster and Nuckolls Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM Monday to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Areas of rain will develop across the area Monday morning as temperatures hover just above freezing, and remain there through the remainder of the daytime hours. The greatest travel impacts will occur Monday night into Tuesday morning due to falling temperatures and rain changing to freezing rain and snow. The highest snow accumulations are expected to be north of the Platte River, but an inch, or so, will be possible as far south as the Nebraska, Kansas state line. Exact storm track remains somewhat uncertain, and only a couple of degrees warmer or colder will have immense influence on local impacts. Stay tuned for updated information!.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
